archetypes.name: Population I Star System
archetypes.description: A young, metal-rich star supporting diverse planetary formations characterized by metal-rich environments and vibrant, dynamic surfaces.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Planets show rich metallic patterns and bright contrasting colors, with active geological features.

selectionBias.biasDescription: More likely in regions with high metallicity and younger systems.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Stars disperse material through supernova, forming planetary nebulae.

formation.formationProcess: Formed from supernova remnants of previous generations, enriching the surrounding space with metals.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Derived from enriched stellar nurseries leading to metal-rich star formation.

formation.yukaGuidance: Focus on regions with high metallicity for potential habitability and diverse planetary setups.

archetypes.name: Population II Star System
archetypes.description: An ancient, metal-poor star offering stable and carbon/silicate-rich planetary formations with subtle and muted color schemes.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Planets exhibit muted tones and weathered surface textures, emphasizing silicate formations.

selectionBias.biasDescription: Preferable in areas with low metallicity and older stellar populations.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Stable star releases low-metallicity gases over time.

formation.formationProcess: Formed from primordial gas clouds, with minimal metallic content determined by early universe conditions.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Formed under stable early universe conditions, providing a basis for older planetary systems.

formation.yukaGuidance: Best suited for ancient world development scenarios or carbon-dominated environments.

archetypes.name: Binary Star System
archetypes.description: A dual star system providing complex gravitational dynamics, influencing planetary orbits and creating unique temperature zones.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Planets have pronounced tidal features, with temperature variations causing distinct surface patterns.

selectionBias.biasDescription: Favored in systems with dual star conditions and complex gravitational potentials.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Binaries give rise to complex tidal disruptions, eroding material unevenly.

formation.formationProcess: Stars captured in mutual orbits affect the material distribution and planet formation rates.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Star captures induce unique orbital characteristics, creating diverse planetary formations.

formation.yukaGuidance: Opt for diverse and multi-faceted planetary developments around binary interactions.

archetypes.name: Post-Supernova Enrichment Zone
archetypes.description: A system enriched by supernova events, containing rare heavy elements that enable planet formation with rare materials and unique chemical properties.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Enriched elements result in volatile surface conditions and visually dynamic landscapes.

selectionBias.biasDescription: Common in areas with recent supernova activity and abundant heavy metals.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Material disbursement challenges include high-energy supernova dispersals.

formation.formationProcess: Originates from regions influenced by supernova, embedding heavy elements into resultant stars and planets.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Exogenous enrichment leads to heavy element accumulation in stars and planets.

formation.yukaGuidance: Focus on rich element stratification and stellar remnants for unique formation opportunities.

archetypes.name: Protoplanetary Disk Disruption
archetypes.description: A star born from a disrupted protoplanetary disk, leading to eccentric planetary orbits and diverse surface patterns on celestial bodies.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Planets have distinctive rings and chaotic surface cracking due to varying orbital influences.

selectionBias.biasDescription: Arises in environments with gravitational disturbances altering disk cohesion.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Disruptive forces distribute material unevenly during disbandment.

formation.formationProcess: Formed when gravitational forces disturb the cohesion of a protoplanetary disk during star formation.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Gravitational interactions cause protoplanetary disk fragmentation.

formation.yukaGuidance: Target areas of dynamic gravitational influence for irregular and eccentric world creation.

archetypes.name: Multigenerational Nursery System
archetypes.description: A star system formed over multiple stellar generations, providing varied elemental compositions and complex planetary forms.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Diverse mixes of geological and metallic surfaces reflect the rich history of material accumulation.

selectionBias.biasDescription: Favored in regions with multiple overlapping stellar generations.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Material dispersal is gradual, involving cosmic redeposition events over generations.

formation.formationProcess: Sequential star formation cycles enrich and diversify the material baselines of subsequent generations.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Accumulated material from many generations supports diverse planet formation.

formation.yukaGuidance: Consider multi-generational interaction zones for expansive, complex ecosystems.

archetypes.name: Nucleosynthesis Cloud System
archetypes.description: A system formed from primordial nucleosynthesis clouds, offering a pure element balance conducive to diverse elemental chemistry on planets.

visualProperties.proceduralRules: Planets display smooth, elemental transitions often leading to varied surface mineralogies.

selectionBias.biasDescription: Visible in zones with rich early primordial matter concentrations.

deconstruction.deconstructionProcess: Primordial origins preserve elemental integrity through gradual dispersion.

formation.formationProcess: Formed from the primordial aftermath of big bang nucleosynthesis, offering a base element slate.

synthesisFrom.causalChain: Material comes from big bang nucleosynthesis to supply rich elemental variety.

formation.yukaGuidance: Prioritize an elemental focus, offering abundant chemical variety at planetary bases.
